org.stanwood.media.renamer
Class Renamer

java.lang.Object
  org.stanwood.media.renamer.Renamer

public class Renamer
extends java.lang.Object

This class is used to rename show episodes in a directory to the correct name. The pattern given is the format of the name. The following are valid values: 

  %h - show Id
        %s - series number  
  %e - episode number
  %% - add a % char
  %n - show name
  %t - episode or film title  
  %x - extension (avi, mkv....)

          Constructor used to create a instance of the class

Constructor Detail

Renamer

public Renamer(java.lang.Long id,
               Mode mode,
               java.io.File showDirectory,
               java.lang.String pattern,
               java.lang.String[] exts,
               boolean refresh)
Constructor used to create a instance of the class

Parameters:
id - The id of the show or film to rename
mode - Used to tell the renamer what mode to work in
showDirectory - The directory it is located in
pattern - The pattern to use while renaming
exts - The extensions to search for
refresh - If true, then don't read from the stores
Method Detail

tidyShowNames

public void tidyShowNames()
                   throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                          java.io.IOException,
                          SourceException,
                          StoreException
This will cause the renaming to happen.

Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException - Thrown if their is a problem creating URL's
java.io.IOException - Thrown if their is a IO problem. For example, not been about to read from the disc.
SourceException - Thrown if their is a problem reading from the source
StoreException - Thrown is their is a problem with a store
